intro: Kallophyllon crenatum, commonly known as the serrated rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves with a serrated edge, and its flowers are typically pink or reddish in color. Kallophyllon crenatum thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is drought-tolerant and well-adapted to harsh, sunny environments.
